member.name: T:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage
member.summary: Provides properties and methods for constructing an e-mail message.
member.remarks: To send an e-mail message defined by an instance of this class, use the SMTP class.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EMailMessage class.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPartFormat)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EMailMessage class with the subject, recipient, sender, text and format of the message.
member.param: The body text of the message.
One of the BodyPartFormat values specifying the format of the body part.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.Reset
member.summary: Clears all existing members and collections.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.CharsetEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the character encoding of the e-mail message.
member.value: One of the values that indicates the encoding type of the e-mail message. Default: System.Text.Encoding.ASCII.
member.remarks: This property should be set for messages composed with character sets other than US-ASCII. See the System.Text.Encoding class in the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.CustomHeaders
member.summary: Gets the CustomHeaderCollection object.
member.value: A object.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.BodyParts
member.summary: Gets the BodyPartCollection object.
member.value: A object.
member.remarks: The FreeSMTP.Net assembly supports a maximum of one plain text body part and one HTML body part. The retail version of Quiksoft's SMTP .Net assembly supports an unlimited number of body parts.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets the subject of the e-mail message..
member.value: The subject line of the e-mail message.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority of the e-mail message..
member.value: The priority value. See remarks.
member.remarks: Setting this property will cause an "X-Priority" header to be added to the message with the value specified. Different mail readers may interpret the X-Priority setting differently. Some may not interpret it at all. The popular readers interpret "4"=low, "3"=normal and "1"=high.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.Recipients
member.summary: Gets the RecipientCollection object.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.Attachments
member.summary: Gets the object.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage.From
member.summary: Gets the object specifying the sender of the message.
member.value: An object.
member.remarks: The value specified by this property is used with the SMTP "MAIL FROM" command during the SMTP conversation. This command indicates to the SMTP host, the e-mail address of the message sender. Most mail servers will accept mail from anyone, however some mail servers will only accept mail from some senders.

member.name: T:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.SMTPStatus
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the SMTPStatus event of the SMTP Object.
member.param: Total bytes sent for this message.
Total size of this message in bytes.

member.name: T:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.SMTP
member.summary: Provides properties and methods for sending messages using the SMTP protocol.
member.remarks: The SMTP object will send messages to an SMTP server or queue them for delivery by SMTPExpress.

member.name: F:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.SMTP.m_pStatus
member.summary: Private Member

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.SMTP.QuickSend(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPartFormat)
member.summary: Sends an e-mail message without needing to create an object instance of the SMTP class.
member.param: The text of the message body
One of the BodyPartFormat values specifying the format of the body part
member.exception: Thrown when file cannot be read.
Thrown when there is an SMTP protocol error.
Thrown when a connection error occurs.
member.example: SMTP.QuickSend("mail.domain.com", "webmaster@localhost","jdoe@quiksoft.com", "My Subject", "Hello how are you?", BodyPartFormat.Plain);

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.SMTP.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SMTP class with the SMTP mail server name or address.
member.param: Name or address of the SMTP server

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.SMTP.Reset
member.summary: Clears all existing members and collections.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.SMTP.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SMTP class.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.SMTP.SubmitToExpress(Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage,System.String)
member.summary: The SubmitToExpress method queues an e-mail message for delivery by SMTPExpress.
member.param: A reference to the EMailMessage object to queue
The path to the Easymail SMTPExpress directory on the computer where EasyMailSMTP Express is installed.
member.exception: Thrown when a file cannot be written to or read from.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.SMTP.Send(Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.EmailMessage)
member.summary: Sends an e-mail message to an SMTP server.
member.param: A reference to the EMailMessage object to send
member.exception: Thrown when file cannot be read.
Thrown when there is an SMTP protocol error.
Thrown when a connection error occurs.

member.summary: Adds or removes a SMTPStatus delegate that is called with progress data as an e-mail message is being sent.

member.summary: Gets the SMTPServerCollection object.
member.value: The object

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.SMTP.LogFile
member.summary: Get or sets the path and filename of log file to output all transactions with the server.
member.remarks: Path to log file must already exist. The file will be created if it does not already exist, otherwise it will be appended to.

member.summary: Adds a SMTPServer object to the collection.
member.remarks: Free SMTP component can only have one SMTP server specified.
member.param: A reference to an object to add to the collection.

member.name: T:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.Attachment
member.summary: Provides properties and methods for constructing an e-mail attachment.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.Attachment.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Attachment class.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.Attachment.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Attachment class with the attachment filename.
member.param: Name of the file to attach

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.Attachment.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Attachment class with the attachment filename and display name.
member.param: Name of the file to attach
Filename used to label the attachment in the e-mail message. See the DisplayName Property for more information.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.Attachment.Filename
member.summary: Gets and sets the filename of the attachment.
member.value: The full path and filename of the attachment.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.Attachment.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets and sets the filename used to label the attachment in the e-mail message. See remarks.
member.value: The filename used to label the attachment in the e-mail message. See remarks.
member.remarks: The DisplayName property allows you to label the attachment in the e-mail message with a name that is different than the original filename. This is useful if you are adding an attachment with a temporary file name such as 03230234.dat and want it to be labeled in the message by a more friendly name such as budget.xls. If the DisplayName property is not specified, the attachment will be labeled in the message with its original filename.

member.name: T:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.AttachmentCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of Attachment objects.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.AttachmentCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AttachmentCollection class

member.summary: Adds an attachment object to the collection.
member.param: Attachment object to add to the collection.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.AttachmentCollection.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an Attachment object using specified values and adds it to the AttachmentCollection.
member.param: The full path and filename of the attachment to add to the collection.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.AttachmentCollection.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an Attachment object using specified values and adds it to the AttachmentCollection.
member.param: The full path and filename of the attachment to add to the collection.
Filename used to identify the attachment in the e-mail message. See the DisplayName Property for more information.

member.name: T:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPart
member.summary: Provides properties and methods for constructing a body part of an e-mail message.
member.remarks: The body text is the main body of the message. The FreeSMTP.Net assembly supports a maximum of one plain text body part and one HTML body part. The retail version of Quiksoft's SMTP .Net assembly supports an unlimited number of body parts.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPart.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BodyPart class with a body.
member.param: The text of the body part.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPart.#ctor(System.String,Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPartFormat)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BodyPart class with a body and its format.
member.param: The text of the body part
One of the BodyPartFormat values specifying the format of the body part
member.exception: Thrown when an invalid value is specified.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPart.#ctor(System.String,Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPartFormat,Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPartEncoding)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BodyPart class with a body, its format and encoding.
member.param: The text of the body part
One of the BodyPartFormat values specifying the format of the body part
One of the BodyPartEncoding values specifying the encoding method to use on the body part
member.exception: Thrown when an invalid value is specified.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPart.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BodyPart class.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPart.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the body part.
member.value: The text of the body part.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPart.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the body part.
member.value: One of the BodyPartFormat values specifying the format of the body part. Default: BodyPartFormat.Plain
member.exception: Thrown when an invalid value is specified.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.FreeSMTP.BodyPart.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding method to use on the body part.
member.value: One of the BodyPartEncoding values specifying the encoding method to use on the body part. Default: BodyPartEncoding.QuotedPrintable
member.exception: Thrown when an invalid value is specified.

member.remarks: The FreeSMTP.Net assembly supports a maximum of one plain text body part and one HTML body part. The retail version of Quiksoft's SMTP .Net assembly supports an unlimited number of body parts.

ne of the BodyPartEncoding values specifying the encoding method to use on the body part.
